abstract_summ: The use of bariatric procedures is increasing due to their efficacy in weight reduction and improved management of the associated medical conditions . Granular cell tumors in the gastrointestinal tract are rare . Herein we describe a case of a gastric GCT diagnosed preoperatively by endoscopic ultrasound-guided fine needle aspiration biopsy . The tumor was successfully resected by single-incision laparoscopic surgery (SILS)
